snippet: “On the Other Side of the River,” translated from Peretz Hirshbein’s Yiddish original and staged at Here, centers on a young woman whose parents drowned and now feels threatened by rising waters.
abstract: Ken Jaworowski reviews New Worlds Theater Project production of Peretz Hirshbein play On the Other Side of the River, directed by Shannon Sindelar and starring Jane Cortney at Here arts center.
lead_paragraph: “On the Other Side of the River,” translated from Peretz Hirshbein’s Yiddish original and staged at Here, centers on a young woman whose parents drowned and now feels threatened by rising waters.

headline.seo: ‘On the Other Side of the River,’ Translated From Yiddish
headline.main: Is the Menace the River, or the Man on the Bank?
